reviews.review_msg: Dr storr is the best!! Made himself super available for help, and was very helpful. I also took this course with Leznoff and warren and storr is a thousand times better. Only good things to say about him!

He's a nice teacher. However, what he teaches is not on the exam at all. I did the entire textbook and homework and barely passed. Class avg was below 50, which was considered high. Chem 121 is a hard class with the lab especially. I'd recommend taking chem 120, and 126 separately. Tim a nice prof but this course is not it.
He is very organized and clear in lectures, his exams are difficult but they are not impossible pay close attention to practice midterms and finals and do as many as you can find.

DO NOT BUY TEXTBOOK I bought it but never used it once. Maybe you want one but at least wait and see if your actually going to use it. Great prof. very engaging lectures and very fair tests. Homework is very challenging, find people to work on it with as it is very difficult to do alone. Labs are stressful, read ahead of time.
He was a good lecturer, the course itself is just A LOT so it was hard to absorb everything in class. Do the homework and use reading break to study for the midterm and you'll be okay. (probably)

The prof does not post the completed slides which makes hard if you don't write something or miss the lecture. He only reads off from the slides which makes it hard to understand. He will have only one or two practice questions in the slides for which he won't post the answer key afterwards. Avoid taking class with him.

between the weekly homework and studying for the labs, this class will keep you busy. tim does not teach enough to understand the hw. the lectures are usually theory based, so it doesn't help with the homework. if you ask him questions during class he'll answer them too quick to actually be able to understand. not a very good prof but he's nice ig

Goes too fast during lectures, covers 120+ slides in class (50 minute class), so it's hard to keep up. Lectures don't help with the homework, but he has regular office hours if you need help. You can see his passion for chem. He genuinely loves it. He doesn't go in depth about much though. Find better lectures online so you understand the content..
Chem 121 is an extremely tough course but tim made it easy! I would recommend taking this class with him

I think it's ridiculous he won't post his finished lecture notes after each class bc it "lowers attendance". Honestly this whole format is outdated to a time when electronics weren't widely used. All notes and lecture materials should be made available on canvas. He's incredibly old school and it hurts students ability to learn.
Tim is pretty chill and an amazing prof. Recommend taking his class

Amazing professor and my favourite so far at SFU. I transferred from Douglas and his class was the first in-person lecture I had there. During the atmospheric river that happened, I was worried the nearby river to my house would flood and I would have to evacuate. Dr Storr was going to cancel his class to help if anything happened too!

Tim is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Super interesting stuff that he talks about as "extras" in the class relating to his reasearch. Also, super nice guy and accessible at all times. He takes things out of the textbook problems for exams and also posts super useful exam practice questions which can show up too. I love this guy.

Tim is a super nice guy and a really good prof, def cares about his students. Can def do this course without the textbook, just make sure u take good notes in his lectures and really pay attention. Provides you with plenty of good practice material and is a fair marker.
Tim is good professor. He's very accessible during office hours and offers great help for concepts you don't understand. Lectures are heavy however, he will cover 40+ slides in one 50 minute lecture.

Great Guy and super helpful. Chem 121 is tough and pretty boring and he really wants to transform it into something unique. He's super passionate and super friendly. He's the type of prof you would wave hello to in the hall. Visit his office hours and your grade will look great. I realise how good he was now that I dont have him any more.
Notes can be confusing, you have to be really focused and follow. The textbook was my saving grace in this course.  Otherwise, the prof is really nice and is ready to help.

He is a good teacher but the course is difficult and the exams are difficult too. He did go through lots of materials in class but very quickly. Students usually have to read a lot and figure out things by themselves.
Exams were fair, just have to put in the work.  Lectures were very organized and he always welcomed questions

Tim just talks and doesnt really teach anything. He covers a lot of material very quickly and leaves students to do a lot of catch-up and learning on their own. He provides practice exams and review sessions, but his exams are significantly harder than the review questions. Be prepared to do lots of work on your own and still be lost and confused.

He's a very nice and organized professor, however he just reads off a PowerPoint making it uninteresting, thus hard to pay attention. You really have to do extra work, because just going to the lectures isn't enough. I learned more in tutorials than I did in lecture.
He's an amazing prof, very good at explaining the content and tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams. Also holds alot of review sessions and office hours for extra help.

Professor Storr was ok, he's friendly and does cool experiments in lectures sometimes. However, the lectures are mostly theory based and fall off short once it comes to actually doing the loncapa assignments/mid-term. The course itself is fairly difficult and moves at a fast pace.
lectures are dry and the course is hard plus the content is heavy for a first year chem course

He is a good teacher, but the midterm was very difficult. I studied one week in advance for the midterm and did awful, I feel as the notes did not cover what was in the midterm, so the textbook examples are mandatory. His lectures have cool experiments, but it's hard to pay attention as so much material is covered in a short amount of time.

Does a good job of explaining the main concepts, and helps with some of the harder LON CAPA questions. Fair marker and manages to keep the class fun from time to time without falling behind or rushing.

Cool prof, does a lot of small experiments in class to demonstrate chemical principles, which are always cool.  Assigns a lot of loncapa questions, but he goes through some of the tough ones in the lecture. Very good prof.

Dr. Storr is probably the best professor I've had. Very good social skills on top of his incredible knowledge of chemistry combine for an excellent presenter. Giving a lecture is really a performance, he and is like a trained actor. Highly recommend taking a class with him.
Great professor who genuinely cares about his students' succeeding. Tests and marking were fair. Looking forward to taking more classes with him.
Great professor. He is a light hearted guy and keeps the class interesting. One of the best, if not the best professor I have had.

One of the most organized and helpful professors ever. He always brings extra sets of notes to class, keeps his office hours, and every question asked will be answered (if he doesn't know right away, he comes back next time with the answer). Also, his exams have no surprises as he's covered all the aspects in class.
Best prof. He is so organized and answers any question you have...and then comes in the next day with another answer just to make sure you understand.

Very organized and even brings extra copies of notes for students. Very helpful, keeps lots of hours available for students. Fair exams. Presents material very well. He's a bit serious at first, but lightens up later. Great job for (I think) his first term teaching here. Should have him teach other classes!
